 Comments   
Comment by Alexander Kelly [ 08/Jun/18 ]

Uses Microsoft Spatializer and an audio source in front of your face. Seems to produce some degree of directional audio. Proper Spatialization would require a more complex solution, e.g. Ambisonics.

item.title: [VR-671] Play 360 Videos loaded as a resource in Gen4 With Command+Node from resource
item.description:
Play 360 Videos in Gen4 (VR-648)

[VR-671] Play 360 Videos loaded as a resource in Gen4 With Command+Node from resource Created: 06/Jun/18  Updated: 13/Jun/18  Resolved: 13/Jun/18

Status: Done
Project: Gen4 VR
Component/s: None
Affects Version/s: None
Fix Version/s: None

Type: Sub-task Priority: Medium
Reporter: Alexander Kelly Assignee: Unassigned
Resolution: Done Votes: 0
Labels: None
Remaining Estimate: Not Specified
Time Spent: Not Specified
Original Estimate: Not Specified

Sprint: Something Something Quadbikes

 Comments   
Comment by Alexander Kelly [ 07/Jun/18 ]

Notes:

  • There is a Node to play the video, which has a checkbox for if its 360 video or not.
  • Regular video's can also be played. They appear over the screen.
  • Video's are packed into the rmx file, so don't make the video too huge.
  • There is a strange bug with targetCameraAlpha where a fully opaque video won't render at all. The alpha has been set at not-quite-one, which means that the video's played are very slightly transparent.
item.author: Alexander Kelly

item.title: [VR-651] Implement Farm Shed
item.description:
[VR-651] Implement Farm Shed Created: 06/Jun/18  Updated: 13/Jun/18  Resolved: 13/Jun/18

Status: Done
Project: Gen4 VR
Component/s: None
Affects Version/s: None
Fix Version/s: None

Type: Story Priority: Medium
Reporter: Alexander Kelly Assignee: Unassigned
Resolution: Done Votes: 0
Labels: None
Σ Remaining Estimate: Not Specified Remaining Estimate: Not Specified
Σ Time Spent: Not Specified Time Spent: Not Specified
Σ Original Estimate: Not Specified Original Estimate: Not Specified

Sub-Tasks:
Key
 Summary
 Type
 Status
 Assignee
VR-655 Find Shed Sub-task Done Tristan Taylor  
VR-656 Populate Shed with Farming Equipment Sub-task Done Tristan Taylor  
VR-679 Build base terrain Sub-task Done Tristan Taylor  
Epic Link: SafeWork Quadbike
Sprint: Something Something Quadbikes

 Description   

Acceptance Criteria:

  • A shed that is large enough to house a quadbike, side by side, and enough room to add additional equipment as required.
  • A large opening for vehicles to be able to drive in and out of.
  • This opening is to have sliding doors rather than a roller door
  • The floor is to be a concrete slab
  • The walls are to be corrugated colourbond or similar
  • There are to be windows in the shed

 Comments   
Comment by Tristan Taylor [ 12/Jun/18 ]

Farmland scene
item.author: Alexander Kelly

item.title: [VR-649] Vignetting and Fade in/out
item.description:

Sub-Tasks:
Key
 Summary
 Type
 Status
 Assignee
VR-666 Get Unity Official Post Processing St... Sub-task Done Alexander Kelly  
VR-667 Get Post Processing stack on regular ... Sub-task Done Alexander Kelly  
VR-668 Add RockML commands and Nodes for Vig... Sub-task In Review Alexander Kelly  
Epic Link: SafeWork Quadbike
Sprint: Something Something Quadbikes, This sprinter is low on ink

 Description   

Add RockML command + Node for Fade and Vignetting the camera.

 

Acceptance Criteria:

  • The oculus and regular cameras can have an effect applied to them to simulate someone fading in and out of consciousness - having their peripheral vision blacked out
  • The effect can be controlled through a command
  • The time taken to change from one vignette state to another can be set through an attribute on the command
  • A fade out / fade in command can be run to make the transition between warp points more obvious
item.author: Alexander Kelly

item.title: [VR-642] As a Trainer, I don't want to have to reconfigure the Oculus each time
item.description:
[VR-642] As a Trainer, I don't want to have to reconfigure the Oculus each time Created: 06/Jun/18  Updated: 13/Jun/18

Status: PBIs in Sprint
Project: Gen4 VR
Component/s: None
Affects Version/s: None

Resolution: Unresolved Votes: 0
Labels: None
Remaining Estimate: Not Specified
Time Spent: Not Specified
Original Estimate: Not Specified

Sprint: Something Something Quadbikes, This sprinter is low on ink

 Description   

Investigate setting up some sort of mat with positions and orientations for the Rifts, that if used, the Rift would not have to be reconfigured.

 

Acceptance Criteria:

  • A bar mat or similar has been designed and sent off for printing
  • The bar mat has circles showing where the sensors go
  • The bar mat has arrows showing which way to point the camera
  • The bar mat shows which angle the sensors should be angled
  • The bar mat has a Gen4 VR logo on it
item.author: Alexander Kelly

item.title: [VR-496] Assign User to a Site
item.description:
A User must be assigned to a Company (VR-492)

[VR-496] Assign User to a Site Created: 09/May/18  Updated: 13/Jun/18

Status: In Progress
Project: Gen4 VR
Component/s: None
Affects Version/s: None
Fix Version/s: None

Type: Sub-task Priority: Medium
Reporter: Brenna Bensley Assignee: Brenna Bensley
Resolution: Unresolved Votes: 0
Labels: Cloud
Remaining Estimate: Not Specified
Time Spent: Not Specified
Original Estimate: Not Specified

Sprint: A Little Less Docker, container communications, 23/05/2018 Improvised, Something Something Quadbikes, This sprinter is low on ink

 Description   

On signup, a user selects (or is selected?) the company and site he/she works at.

One possible flow is:

  • Select Company from drop down
  • Then another drop down appears with active sites within that company.

Matt Fanning, what do you think?

 Comments   
Comment by Matt Fanning [ 12/May/18 ]

In the beginning, there won't be many companies in the list, so this would need to be skippable. Additionally, i feel as though a company would have to accept the user in.

Comment by Matt Fanning [ 12/May/18 ]

Another thing would be that SAML would potentially automatically enroll users if that's what the company wants
item.author: Brenna Bensley

item.title: [LMS-33] Upload a course as a SCORM/xAPI zip file
item.description:
[LMS-33] Upload a course as a SCORM/xAPI zip file Created: 04/Apr/18  Updated: 06/Jun/18

Status: Groomed
Project: LMS
Component/s: None
Affects Version/s: None
Fix Version/s: None

Type: Story Priority: Highest
Reporter: Jyotishko Das Assignee: Unassigned
Resolution: Unresolved Votes: 0
Labels: Sprint1, Upload_XAPIs,SCOORMS,eLearns,(VR), interim
Remaining Estimate: Not Specified
Time Spent: Not Specified
Original Estimate: Not Specified

Sprint: Something Something Quadbikes

 Description   

As a Content Creator

I want to accept a course as a SCORM zip file

So That I can upload that package to my LMS

Acceptance Criteria

I am able to upload a Zip XAPI (SCOORM) file to the system and a course is created in the system will all relevant content.

 Comments   
Comment by Jyotishko Das [ 25/May/18 ]

This user story refers to the scenario, where a basic course (in a SCORM/xAPI) format can be uploaded to the LMS. After the course is uploaded, the course creator, admin and relevant learner(s) should be able to have access to the course and its relevant contents.
item.author: Jyotishko Das
